intro: Railliardia struthioloides, commonly known as the golden star orchid, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking golden-yellow flowers with a star-like appearance. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), which helps it retain moisture in humid environments. Railliardia struthioloides is valued in horticulture for its ornamental beauty and ability to thrive in well-drained, nutrient-rich substrates.
